SEARCH
Package gw.api.bean.compare.ui

Class PropertyDiffDisplay

java.lang.Object
gw.api.bean.compare.ui.PropertyDiffDisplay
All Implemented Interfaces:
DiffDisplay
public class PropertyDiffDisplay extends Object implements DiffDisplay
Superclass for displaying property diffs in the entity comparison UI. This class can be used as is or subclassed by customers to give more control over the UI. There is no direct mechanism for customers to specify their own subclass (or alternative implementation) for PropertyDiffDisplay. The only approach at the moment is to override the HierarchicalDiff.addChild(DiffDisplay) method in the DiffDisplay object used to display an entity (typically some subclass of EntityDiffDisplay). The addChild method can then watch for incoming children of type PropertyDiffDisplay and replace them with a custom subtype or alternative type.

    • getDiff

    • getLabel

      public String getLabel()
      The label used in the UI when displaying a property difference. The default implementation looks for a display key of the form entity.TypeName.PropertyName (for example entity.Person.LastName) where TypeName is the name of the type that owns the property and PropertyName is the property's name. If no such display key exists then the name of the property is used as it is. Normally display keys should be defined for all properties that may be displayed, the name of the property is not usually a good UI label.
      Specified by:
      getLabel in interface DiffDisplay
      Returns:
      a non null label

    • getOldValue

      public String getOldValue()
      The old value of the property, as a user displayable string. Returns the empty string if the old value is null.
      Specified by:
      getOldValue in interface DiffDisplay
      Returns:
      a string value, never null
